text: When this Oracle EC2 instance is first run,
you will be prompted to review the license agreement for Oracle Enterprise Linux
and the Oracle Technology Developer License Terms.
After you have done so, type y to accept.
You will need to set a password for the oracle operating system login.
Enter a password, and retype the password to confirm.
Next, we will configure the database software.
Type y to create a database now.
You will be prompted to select a disk device to save your datafiles and redo logs.
In this example, we will use the default.
Hit enter, and type y to confirm.
Use the default again when selecting the disk device for the flash recovery area files,
and type y to confirm.
Enter a name for your Oracle database.
We will use testdb.
Next, we will set passwords for the database administrative accounts.
Enter a password for the SYS, SYSTEM, DBSNMP, SYSMAN, and ADMIN users.
Your database has been configured, and it is now being created.
This may take a while.
After this process has completed, continue to the next video
to configure the OSB Cloud Module.
